boat.name: Little Apple
boat.full_description:
'Little Apple' was built by Paynters in 1905. At some point, probably in the 1920s, she was renamed 'White Heather'. She had a mixed career of oyster dredging, racing and day sailing. An extensive restoration was carried out around 1960, including the fitting of an iron keel. After a change of owner in the late 1960s she was neglected, sunk by a paint float from Falmouth Docks and subsequently salvaged to Penryn Creek.

In 1970 she was transported by road and ferry to Guernsey and got sailing again. From 1973 she was based at Ferrybridge, Portland Harbour, back under the name 'Little Apple'. She was the first winner of the Edgar March memorial trophy. A feat repeated some years later. She was at the first Bucktrout and St Malo Rally in 1977.

In 1979 the cabin top was added. A further major refit took place in 1992.
